verses.verse: Because you (Ps. 107:11; Luke 7:30) disdained all my counsel, And would have none of my rebuke,
(Ps. 2:4) I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your terror comes,
When ((Prov. 10:24, 25)) your terror comes like a storm, And your destruction comes like a whirlwind, When distress and anguish come upon you.

“Then (1 Sam. 8:18; Job 27:9; 35:12; Ps. 18:41; Is. 1:15; Jer. 11:11; 14:12; Ezek. 8:18; Mic. 3:4; Zech. 7:13; (James 4:3)) they will call on me, but I will not answer; They will seek me diligently, but they will not find me.
Because they (Job 21:14; Prov. 1:22) hated knowledge And did not (Ps. 119:173) choose the fear of the LORD,
(Ps. 81:11; Prov. 1:25) They would have none of my counsel And despised my every rebuke.
Therefore (Job 4:8; Prov. 5:22, 23; 22:8; Is. 3:11; Jer. 6:19) they shall eat the fruit of their own way, And be filled to the full with their own fancies.
For the turning away of the simple will slay them, And the complacency of fools will destroy them;
But whoever listens to me will dwell (Prov. 3:24-26) safely, And (Ps. 112:7) will be secure, without fear of evil.”
The Value of Wisdom My son, if you receive my words, And ((Prov. 4:21)) treasure my commands within you,
So that you incline your ear to wisdom, And apply your heart to understanding;
Yes, if you cry out for discernment, And lift up your voice for understanding,
((Prov. 3:14)) If you seek her as silver, And search for her as for hidden treasures;
((James 1:5, 6)) Then you will understand the fear of the LORD, And find the knowledge of God.
(1 Kin. 3:9, 12; (Job 32:8; James 1:5)) For the LORD gives wisdom; From His mouth come knowledge and understanding;
He stores up sound wisdom for the upright; ((Ps. 84:11); Prov. 30:5) He is a shield to those who walk uprightly;
He guards the paths of justice, And ((1 Sam. 2:9); Ps. 66:9) preserves the way of His saints.
Then you will understand righteousness and justice, Equity and every good path.
When wisdom enters your heart, And knowledge is pleasant to your soul,
Discretion will preserve you; (Prov. 4:6; 6:22) Understanding will keep you,
To deliver you from the way of evil, From the man who speaks perverse things,
From those who leave the paths of uprightness To (Ps. 82:5; Prov. 4:19; (John 3:19, 20)) walk in the ways of darkness;
